~~Yet another incredibly questionable move by Riot.~~

Actually, no. It's a good move by Riot as long as they (Medieval Twitch and Grey Warwick) DO "return as rewards for another social system somewhere down the line". RAF became pretty hard to do after the initial influx of people who started playing LoL. Not to mention RAF was never enabled on OCE up until a few months ago after all of my IRL friends had already started playing. The only way to get RAF rewards was by making smurfs, which is not what RAF was created to achieve and is what prompted the massive rework of RAF in the first place.

You've said it very well my friend! 
As long as those skins are/will be made available via another route, I concur with this decision. Most of the friends I've got are ones I've made through League, which makes RAF kind of redundant for me and I'm sure that's the case with many people who play League.

I really wanted those skins but couldn't be bothered training 5 smurfs to get them. I don't make new friends very often IRL as I've had the same group of friends since I started highschool in 2007 and we all started playing league in around 2012 so.

yeah that's my issue too i wasn't even aware that OCE had finally gotten refer a friend until i saw this and ive gotten all my irl friends on by now...

I dont understand?
why take it out?
its not causing harm to people joining league, its actually helping them to, perhaps not as much as you anticipated but it is helping none-the-less. 

so instead of leaving it be even though it isn't 100% effective (and requires no effort on your part to leave it be) you are going to take it out which removes any possibility of it helping anyone join and it also requires effort on your part as well. there has to be an underlying reason as to why you're taking it out because your reasons don't make any sense.

you even say that party IP, teamup and pool party etc are more effective, yet they do not help people join the game, they are just little luxuries for people who have already joined up. they doth even do the same job as refer a friend... like i said it doesn't make sense?

its like creating a sculpture in a park and spending lots of money and effort to make it and put it there, and then when only a few people look at it instead of the number you were expecting, spending all that money and effort taking it down again, why not just leave it? it can only cause good.

so whats the real reason?

It does say it will reduce botting, which I remember being a hugely annoying problem in early levels. Seems reasonable to remove it to me. Also, I presume it requires some level of maintenance to have the RAF system. Removing it may well cut down on this unnecessary work.
i know, they should've put easier goals and less rewards or at least reduced the required level maybe to 7 ?
